intro: Forsskaolea angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed thornapple, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters, characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as savannas and rocky areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
